questionListItems.title: Is there an option to pay using PayNow or Paylah! rather paying the cost in school?

answer.body: Parents can scan the QR code on the school bill to make payments online. Parents can still continue to pay cash at the school General Office

questionListItems.title: Can we collect the forms in the general office?

answer.body: Yes, you can. You can either collect the hardcopy of the form yourself or ask your child to collect from the school General Office.

questionListItems.title: Can I purchase my own device and let the school install the DMA?

answer.body:
We strongly encourage all parents to purchase the PLD for learning purposes through the school. As stated in the online form and Annex D, parents may opt to purchase their own devices.


Do note you need to purchase a Chromebook with a stylus, fitted with 8GB RAM and 64 GB disk space. As our school is using ChromeOS, our DMA cannot be installed on Windows or iPadOS.


Should you wish to purchase your own device, please inform your child's Form Teacher or speak to the HOD ICT.

questionListItems.title: Can my child use his/her personal Windows laptop or iPad during the lesson?

answer.body: As stated in Paragraph 7, the DMA allows the teacher to manage the students' use of computing device during class time. Your child/ward will not be able to use his/her personal computing device in school.

questionListItems.title: What does it mean by "Repairs or 1 Replacements"?

answer.body: Repairs and Replacements are dealt directly with the vendor. School will help facilitate the repairs and replacements using the fortnightly courier by Vendor. Eg. If the screen is cracked for the first time, parent can opt to repair the screen (free) or ask for a new replacement of the computer.  Should the screen crack for a second time, payment for repairs is needed.
